1.text: “Man, who is born of woman, is short of days and full of trouble.

2.text: Like a flower, he comes forth, then withers away; like a fleeting shadow, he does not endure.

3.text: Do You open Your eyes to one like this? Will You bring him into judgment before You?

4.text: Who can bring out clean from unclean? No one!

5.text: Since his days are determined and the number of his months is with You, and since You have set limits that he cannot exceed,

6.text: look away from him and let him rest, so he can enjoy his day as a hired hand.

7.text: For there is hope for a tree: If it is cut down, it will sprout again, and its tender shoots will not fail.

8.text: If its roots grow old in the ground and its stump dies in the soil,

9.text: at the scent of water it will bud and put forth twigs like a sapling.

10.text: But a man dies and is laid low; he breathes his last, and where is he?

11.text: As water disappears from the sea and a river becomes parched and dry,

12.text: so a man lies down and does not rise. Until the heavens are no more, he will not be awakened or roused from sleep.

13.text: If only You would hide me in Sheol and conceal me until Your anger has passed! If only You would appoint a time for me and then remember me!

14.text: When a man dies, will he live again? All the days of my hard service I will wait, until my renewal comes.

15.text: You will call, and I will answer; You will desire the work of Your hands.

16.text: For then You would count my steps, but would not keep track of my sin.

17.text: My transgression would be sealed in a bag, and You would cover over my iniquity.

18.text: But as a mountain erodes and crumbles and a rock is dislodged from its place,

19.text: as water wears away the stones and torrents wash away the soil, so You destroy a man’s hope.

20.text: You forever overpower him, and he passes on; You change his countenance and send him away.

21.text: If his sons receive honor, he does not know it; if they are brought low, he is unaware.

22.text: He feels only the pain of his own body and mourns only for himself.”
